post_text: August 29, 2018 at 12:23 AM#1So I have multiple macros that help with pre programming and I'm trying to develop one that when the name of the cue is[color=#FF0000]Follow[/color]the macro will change the trig type to follow and ask for a trig time.I tried a few things like [color=#FF33CC][$selectedexeccue /name=="Follow"][/color] but that didn't work.Any ideas?Peyton

posts.post_text: August 29, 2018 at 12:48 AM#2this is not possible with regular commandline.to extract the name of a cue [for comparison] you need to use Lua.if you are not into Lua, you could try installing "Glad's IntelliVars":http://www.ma-share.net/forum/read.php?8,61174be aware that the name of the cue resides in the primary cuepart (Part 0)so after installing IntelliVars you need to do something like this in you macro:CodeCD Part 0selectedexeccue is implicit when just referencing the partCode$CAPTUREadd a small wait 0.1s to allow time to capture data about the cuepartCodeCD /thenCodeSetvar $mycuename=$"C_NAME"[$mycuename=="Follow"] do whatever
